article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 69, Ind.-Pur.-Ft. Wayne 53
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Majak Kou scored 17 points Saturday to lead Loyola of Chicago to a 69-53 over Indiana University-Purdue University-Fort Wayne. Kou was among four Loyola players to score in double figures. The Ramblers led 33-32 at halftime, but used a 10-0 run at the start of the second half to take control of the game for good. Loyola outrebounded the Mastodons 41-29 and outscored IPFW in the paint 34-16. Leon Young scored 16 points, J.R. Blount had 15, and Blake Schilb added 13 for the Ramblers (13-7). IPFW shot just 26.3 percent (5-for-19) from the floor in the second half. Scott DeWitt scored 15 points to lead the Mastodons (7-12).

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
